trans-unit.source: Recover a database from user error in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Recover a database from user error in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Steps for recovering a database from user error in SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Steps for recovering a database from user error in SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Recover a database from user error in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Recover a database from user error in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse offers two core capabilities for recovering from user error that causes unintentional data corruption or deletion:
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse offers two core capabilities for recovering from user error that causes unintentional data corruption or deletion:

trans-unit.source: Restore a live database
trans-unit.target: Restore a live database

trans-unit.source: Restore a deleted database
trans-unit.target: Restore a deleted database

trans-unit.source: Both of these capabilities restore to a new database on the same server.
trans-unit.target: Both of these capabilities restore to a new database on the same server.

trans-unit.source: Recover a live database
trans-unit.target: Recover a live database

trans-unit.source: In the event of user error causing unintended data modification, you can restore the database to any of the restore points within the retention period.
trans-unit.target: In the event of user error causing unintended data modification, you can restore the database to any of the restore points within the retention period.

trans-unit.source: The database snapshots for a live database occur every 8 hours and are retained for 7 days.
trans-unit.target: The database snapshots for a live database occur every 8 hours and are retained for 7 days.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: To restore a database, use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore[]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To restore a database, use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore[]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Select the subscription under your account that contains the database to be restored.
trans-unit.target: Select the subscription under your account that contains the database to be restored.

trans-unit.source: List restore points for the database (requires Azure Resource Management mode)
trans-unit.target: List restore points for the database (requires Azure Resource Management mode)

trans-unit.source: Pick the desired restore point using the RestorePointCreationDate.
trans-unit.target: Pick the desired restore point using the RestorePointCreationDate.

trans-unit.source: Restore the database to the desired restore point.
trans-unit.target: Restore the database to the desired restore point.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the progress of the restore.
trans-unit.target: Monitor the progress of the restore.

trans-unit.source: Note that if your server is foo.database.windows.net, use "foo" as the -ServerName in the powershell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: Note that if your server is foo.database.windows.net, use "foo" as the -ServerName in the powershell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: Get the list of database restore points using the Get Database Restore Points operation.
trans-unit.target: Get the list of database restore points using the Get Database Restore Points operation.

trans-unit.source: Begin your restore by using the <link><linkText>Create database restore request[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Begin your restore by using the <link><linkText>Create database restore request[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Track the status of your restore by using the <link><linkText>Database operation status[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Track the status of your restore by using the <link><linkText>Database operation status[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <link><linkText>Finalize a recovered database[]</linkText><title></title></link> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <link><linkText>Finalize a recovered database[]</linkText><title></title></link> guide.

trans-unit.source: Recover a deleted database
trans-unit.target: Recover a deleted database

trans-unit.source: In the event a database is deleted, you can restore the deleted database to the time of deletion.
trans-unit.target: In the event a database is deleted, you can restore the deleted database to the time of deletion.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Data Warehouse takes a database snapshot before the database is dropped and retains it for 7 days.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Data Warehouse takes a database snapshot before the database is dropped and retains it for 7 days.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform a deleted database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform a deleted database restore.

trans-unit.source: To restore a deleted database, use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore[]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To restore a deleted database, use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore[]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Find the deleted database and its deletion date from the list of deleted databases
trans-unit.target: Find the deleted database and its deletion date from the list of deleted databases

trans-unit.source: Get the specific deleted database and start the restore.
trans-unit.target: Get the specific deleted database and start the restore.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.
trans-unit.target: Use REST to programmatically perform database restore.

trans-unit.source: List all of your restorable deleted databases by using the <link><linkText>List restorable dropped databases[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.
trans-unit.target: List all of your restorable deleted databases by using the <link><linkText>List restorable dropped databases[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Get the details for the deleted database you want to restore by using the <link><linkText>Get restorable dropped database[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Get the details for the deleted database you want to restore by using the <link><linkText>Get restorable dropped database[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Begin your restore by using the <link><linkText>Create database restore request[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Begin your restore by using the <link><linkText>Create database restore request[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Track the status of your restore by using the <link><linkText>Database operation status[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Track the status of your restore by using the <link><linkText>Database operation status[]</linkText><title></title></link> operation.

trans-unit.source: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <link><linkText>Finalize a recovered database[]</linkText><title></title></link> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the restore has completed, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <link><linkText>Finalize a recovered database[]</linkText><title></title></link> guide.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: To learn about the business continuity features of other Azure SQL Database editions, please read the <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database business continuity overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about the business continuity features of other Azure SQL Database editions, please read the <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database business continuity overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
